statements.statement: I cannot be bothered to attempt a new means of course evaluation
I have too many other obligations to implement Q-methodology
My institution does not take course evaluations seriously
I perform course evaluations for my course but do not look at the data
I do not have the ability to analyze Q-methodology data
I am unable to take on more responsibilities such as implementing Q-methodology
Likert scale evaluations are “good enough” for my course
My students are so vocal about changes to my course that I feel that Q-methodology would not offer any new information
I know the best way to teach and do not feel the need to implement course changes based on student feedback
Students are so mean in open-ended surveys that I have contemplated changing career paths because of their feedback
I love the overwhelming praise I get from students through open-ended surveys
Open-ended surveys just give students a means to vent and offers no usable information
Students are more forgiving in Likert scale course evaluations than open-ended surveys
I find interpretation of open-ended surveys to be more important than use of the statistical analysis of Likert / Q-methodology data
I am afraid of what my students will say if given the opportunity to fill out an open-ended survey
The language Q-methodology uses is too complicated and unintuitive
I would be restricted to doing Q-methodology offline as I do not have the ability to host a web-based Q sorting tool
My superiors don’t listen to my ideas so making course change is irrelevant
